result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack D Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Change Name, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.47(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence Credit for 105 days were granted.
Concurrent with: any other sentence he is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with the victim listed.
To comply with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by Agent.  To comply with all rules and regulations of the sex offender registry.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

motion denied, signed by Judge Ramirez.

Defendant Jack D Moore appeared by phone from Oshkosh CI.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses the defendant's motion request.  Court does not have the authority to change the sentence as stated.  Court denies the request.
Hearing on January 9, 2017 at 10:00 am.

received 12/21/16 from Jack Moore regarding sentence
  **Reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 12/27/16-Copy to DA and Defense Counsel.  Set for hearing.  Defendant may appear by phone.**
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event:  for the August 17, 2015 Plea and Sentencing Hearing filed by Erin Furgason.

Defendant Jack D Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Barb Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty. State gives recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Victim makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count #1

Imposed Sentence of:
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 105 days) concurrent to any other sentence he is currently serving. 
3 Years of Initial Confinement
1 Years of Extended Supervision
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

To comply with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent
To comply with all rules and regluations of the sex offender registry
No contact with the victim listed.

Cost: $268.00 to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Body armor warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Jack D Moore did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in custody. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Defendant is to be produced for the next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
